title: Scientists leverage AI to develop an opener for a molecular can - INDIAai
Suspected Marburg virus outbreak in Tanzania kills 8 - Down To Earth Magazine
summary:
Suspected Marburg virus outbreak in Tanzania kills 8

Published on: 16 Jan 2025, 10:44 am | Source: World Health Organization (WHO)

A suspected outbreak of Marburg virus disease (MVD) in Tanzania’s Kagera region has claimed eight lives out of nine reported cases. The Ebola-like virus presents severe symptoms and has a fatality rate of 89 percent.

  • Outbreak reported in Biharamulo and Muleba districts as of January 11, 2025.
  • Rapid response teams deployed by the Tanzanian government for investigation and containment.
  • Contact tracing and testing are underway, with a mobile laboratory established in Kagera.
  • Healthcare workers among suspected infected, raising concerns over infection control.
  • WHO classifies outbreak as high-risk for Tanzania and neighboring countries.
The WHO has warned of significant risk due to the high fatality rate and geographic spread.

In response, communities are advised to avoid close contact with suspected cases and ensure safe handling of deceased individuals.
newTitle: Suspected Marburg virus outbreak in Tanzania kills 8

‘Those courageous to take risks are often most successful’: Who is Justice K Vinod Chandran, set to take oath as Supreme Court judge today - The Indian Express
summary:
‘Those courageous to take risks are often most successful’: Who is Justice K Vinod Chandran, set to take oath as Supreme Court judge today

Publication Date: Thursday
Source: Indian Express

Justice K Vinod Chandran is set to take oath as a judge of the Supreme Court, bringing the total number of judges to 33.

  • Appointed by the Supreme Court Collegium on July 7, 2023.
  • Justice Chandran will have a tenure until April 24, 2028.
  • He previously served as Chief Justice of Patna High Court.
  • Justice Chandran has a background in law and tax litigation, becoming a judge in 2011.
  • He has delivered significant rulings regarding caste surveys and religious attire rights.
“Those who are courageous to take risks are often the most successful.” – Justice K Vinod Chandran

Justice Chandran's appointment is significant for the Supreme Court, and his past judgments reflect a commitment to justice and legal reforms.
newTitle: Justice K Vinod Chandran Takes Oath as Supreme Court Judge

title: 8th Pay Commission for central government employees approved by Cabinet - Hindustan Times
summary:
8th Pay Commission for Central Government Employees Approved by Cabinet

Date: Jan 16, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Union Cabinet has approved the establishment of the 8th Pay Commission to revise salaries of central government employees and pensioners.

  • The decision was made at a Cabinet meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • Appointment of the chairman and two members of the Commission will occur soon.
  • Consultations will include central and state governments and other stakeholders.
  • The 8th Pay Commission comes as an update to the 7th Pay Commission, which was established in 2016.
  • There are over 49 lakh central government employees and nearly 65 lakh pensioners affected by this commission.
“A pay commission is constituted by the central government once every decade to revise the salary structure of its employees.”

The establishment of the 8th Pay Commission is a significant step towards restructuring government employee compensation, reflecting ongoing discussions about employee welfare and fair pay.
newTitle: 8th Pay Commission for Central Government Employees Approved by Cabinet

Mahakumbh Mela 2025 Live Updates: On Day 4, lakhs brave biting cold to take holy dip in Sangam; over 6 crore participants till now - The Indian Express
summary:
Mahakumbh Mela 2025 Live Updates: On Day 4, lakhs brave biting cold to take holy dip in Sangam; over 6 crore participants till now

Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The fourth day of the Mahakumbh Mela 2025 saw devotees from various walks of life taking a dip in the Sangam – the confluence of three rivers Yamuna, Ganga and ‘mystical’ Saraswati – as early as 5 am on Thursday.

  • Over 6 crore devotees have taken a dip in Sangam in the first four days.
  • This number is expected to cross 50 crore by the end of the 45-day festival.
  • Thousands of police personnel have been deployed for maintaining security at the Mahakumbh.
  • 11 tethered drones and anti-drone systems have been implemented for aerial surveillance.
  • Up to 50 crore people are expected to attend the mela, including over 20 lakh foreign travelers.
Mahakumbh history and significance:

The Kumbh Mela, deeply rooted in Hindu mythology, is the world’s biggest religious gathering where participants seek forgiveness and aspire for Moksha (spiritual liberation).
newTitle: Mahakumbh Mela 2025 Day 4: Lakhs Brave Cold for Spiritual Dip

Kashmir receives fresh snow, wet spell predicted ahead - Greater Kashmir
summary:
Kashmir Receives Fresh Snow with More Wet Weather Predicted

Date: January 16, 2023 Source: Local News

Fresh snowfall has hit Kashmir, particularly affecting higher reaches, with forecasts of more wet weather approaching.

  • Tourist resorts like Pahalgam and Sonamarg received snowfall.
  • Light snowfall recorded in the plains of Anantnag, Kulgam, Shopian, Pulwama, and Baramulla.
  • Srinagar started experiencing light snowflakes during the latest reports.
  • The Meteorological Department forecasts cloudy weather with light rain or snow for the rest of the day.
  • From January 20-21, isolated to scattered light snow is anticipated, with light to moderate snow expected from January 22-23.
  • Minimum temperatures in the valley increased, providing some relief from the cold, with Srinagar's temperature at -2.5°C.

Kashmir is currently in the midst of “Chillai-Kalan”, the harshest winter period, lasting until January 30, followed by “Chillai-Khurd” and “Chillai-Bachha”.
newTitle: Kashmir Receives Fresh Snow with More Wet Weather Predicted

title: Mars Satellite Images Reveal Giant 'Kidney Beans,' Sparking Hints of Water and Life - Gadgets 360
summary:
Mars Satellite Images Reveal Giant 'Kidney Beans,' Sparking Hints of Water and Life

Date: Not specified Source: Gadgets 360

Recent observations of frozen dunes on Mars suggest the potential presence of water and microbial life in the planet's past.

  • Frozen sand dunes observed by NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter are stationary due to carbon dioxide frost.
  • Understanding these features can help scientists determine if Mars once had conditions suitable for liquid water.
  • The Martian axial tilt may have supported a thicker atmosphere in the past, impacting its climate.
  • Research on frost patterns aids in uncovering Mars' climatic history and possible habitability.
“Studying these frost-covered dunes helps scientists assess whether liquid water was present on Mars for periods long enough to support life.”

These findings deepen our understanding of Mars' climate evolution and its implications for astrobiology.
newTitle: Mars Satellite Images Reveal Giant 'Kidney Beans,' Sparking Hints of Water and Life

Reliance Industries Q3 FY25 results preview: Net profit seen up 6%, margin expansion expected - Moneycontrol
summary:
Reliance Industries Q3 FY25 results preview: Net profit seen up 6%, margin expansion expected

Date: January 16, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Reliance Industries is set to post a 6% sequential growth in Q3 net profit to Rs 17,482 crore, driven by stronger refining margins and higher ARPU in digital services.

  • Expected Q3 net profit of Rs 17,482 crore.
  • Estimated EBITDA of Rs 41,125 crore, reflecting a 5% quarter-on-quarter growth.
  • Improvement in EBITDA margin estimated between 18.2% and 18.9%.
  • Mixed performance anticipated, with strong telecom earnings and refining margins offsetting weaknesses in petrochemicals.
“RIL’s Q3 results are expected to be supported by robust growth in telecom and refining margins, despite challenges in the retail sector.”

Overall, RIL's Q3 FY25 results are expected to reflect strong earnings growth amidst a challenging market environment.
newTitle: Reliance Industries Q3 FY25 Results Preview: Net Profit Expected to Grow

Kevin Pietersen puts his hand up as India's batting coach to help out struggling Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and others - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kevin Pietersen Offers to be India's Batting Coach Amidst Team's Struggles

Date: Jan 16, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former England captain Kevin Pietersen has expressed his availability as the batting coach for the Indian cricket team following reports of a possible addition to the coaching staff. With India's batting line-up struggling, especially with prominent players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, there are speculations regarding the need for a specialized batting coach.

  • Pietersen currently in South Africa for SA20 broadcasting.
  • BCCI considering adding a batting coach to support staff.
  • Pietersen has a stellar record: 8181 runs in Tests, 4440 in ODIs, and impressive T20 statistics.
  • India's recent Test losses raise questions about the batting performance.
“...a few names are being considered, including former domestic cricket heavyweights. However, no final decision has been made.”

Changes within the coaching setup are under consideration amidst significant criticism directed at recent batting performances, emphasizing the potential benefits of a dedicated batting coach.
newTitle: Kevin Pietersen Offers to be India's Batting Coach Amidst Team's Struggles

realme 14 Pro series launches in India at ₹24,999 with 50MP, 6,000 mAh battery and more

Date: January 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

The realme 14 Pro series has been launched in India with impressive features, including advanced camera technology and eye-catching designs.

  • The series includes two models: realme 14 Pro and realme 14 Pro+.
  • Both models will feature Android 15 and go on sale starting January 23.
  • The realme 14 Pro+ features a 6.74-inch quad-curved AMOLED display and is powered by the Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 chipset.
  • It offers a triple rear camera setup with a 50MP main sensor and a 6000mAh battery with 80W wired charging.
  • The more affordable realme 14 Pro starts at ₹24,999 and features slightly reduced specs.
“The standout Pearl White variant features thermochromic fusion fibre technology, allowing it to turn blue when exposed to cold temperatures.”

This series combines elegant design with robust performance, catering to both aesthetic and technical needs of consumers.
newTitle: realme 14 Pro series launches in India at ₹24,999 with 50MP, 6,000 mAh battery and more

title: Realme 14 Pro and 14 Pro+ go global with AI camera features - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
summary:
Realme 14 Pro and 14 Pro+ Launch with AI Camera Features

Date: Today
Source: GSM Arena

Realme unveiled the 14 Pro series targeting international markets, showcasing the Pro model at a lower price without a periscope camera and featuring a less powerful chipset.

  • The Realme 14 Pro+ has a 6.83" AMOLED display; the 14 Pro features a 6.77" display.
  • Both models support a refresh rate of up to 120 Hz and include an under-display fingerprint scanner.
  • Realme highlights the camera system, particularly the 50 MP main camera with Optical Image Stabilization.
  • Realme claims 120X SuperZoom capability with a combination of optical and digital zoom.
  • The 14 Pro series boasts a 6000 mAh battery with 80W fast charging that offers longevity.
  • The series launches with different color options and price points, aimed at competitive segments in the market.
“Realme ensures 80% battery capacity even after four years of use.”

The Realme 14 Pro series aims to enhance user experience with innovative camera features and competitive pricing, promising to expand its market reach effectively.
newTitle: Realme 14 Pro and 14 Pro+ Launch with AI Camera Features

title: India achieves first space docking, becoming fourth country to achieve major milestone - CNN
summary:
India achieves first space docking, becoming fourth country to achieve major milestone

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: CNN

India made a significant leap in space exploration by becoming the fourth country to successfully execute an unmanned docking in space, marking a pivotal moment for its future missions and cementing its status as a global space power.

  • The successful docking was accomplished through the Space Docking Experiment (SpaDex), deploying two small spacecraft.
  • The spacecraft, weighing about 220 kilograms each, were launched from the Satish Dhawan Space Center.
  • Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated ISRO for their historic achievement, emphasizing its importance for future missions.
  • The technology developed will be essential for future endeavors such as satellite servicing and launching multiple rockets.
  • India aims to send its first astronaut to the moon by 2040 and establish its own space station by 2035.
“Spacecraft docking successfully completed! A historic moment,” the Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO) said on X.

The advancement of in-docking technology is crucial for the future of India's space missions, as it prepares to enhance its operations and capabilities on the international stage.
newTitle: India Achieves First Space Docking, Joining Elite Group of Space Powers

title: Gautam Gambhir Calls Out 'Indiscipline' In Team India, Proposes New Rules To BCCI: Report - NDTV Sports
summary:
Gautam Gambhir Calls Out 'Indiscipline' In Team India, Proposes New Rules To BCCI: Report

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

As the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) contemplates bringing changes to the way the team functions, the families of players are likely to have their privileges taken away. The board has reportedly proposed limited family time on away tours, especially for long assignments.

  • Gautam Gambhir identified 'indiscipline' as a key issue in the Indian cricket team.
  • The BCCI is discussing rule changes regarding family presence on tours.
  • A senior player suggested that match fees should be performance-based rather than distributed immediately.
  • Only one complete team dinner occurred during the team’s stay in Australia.
  • Gambhir's staff privileges have also been curtailed as part of the new measures.
"Indiscipline is the reason why the BCCI is reverting to pre-COVID rules, allowing two weeks of family presence on tour."

The BCCI's proposed changes reflect a push for greater discipline and accountability within the team, prioritizing performance and commitment over personal distractions.
newTitle: Gautam Gambhir Calls Out 'Indiscipline' In Team India, Proposes New Rules To BCCI: Report
